etymologies: late Middle English (in the senses ‘command, appointment to office, or allotment of revenue’): via Old French from Latin assignatio(n-), from the verb assignare (see assign)

definitions: an appointment to meet someone in secret, typically one made by lovers

examples.text: his assignation with an older woman

shortDefinitions: appointment to meet someone in secret

definitions: the allocation or attribution of someone or something as belonging to something

examples.text: this document explains the principles governing the assignation of lexical units to lexemes

shortDefinitions: allocation or attribution of person or thing as belonging to something
